description: Numbers that are congruent to {1, 2, 3, 4} mod 6.
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: From Johannes W. Meijer, Jul 07 2011: (Start)a(n) = floor((n+2)/4) + floor((n+1)/4) + floor((n)/4) + 2*floor((n-1)/4) + floor((n+3)/4).G.f.: x*(1+x+x^2+x^3+2*x^4)/(x^5-x^4-x+1). (End)
mathematica: Complement[Range[100], Flatten[Table[{6n - 1, 6n}, {n, 0, 15}]]] (* _Alonso del Arte_, Jul 07 2011 *)Select[Range[100], MemberQ[{1, 2, 3, 4}, Mod[#, 6]]&] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jan 06 2013 *)
prog: (MAGMA) [n: n in [0..100] | n mod 6 in [1..4]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jan 06 2013
crossrefs: Cf. A047245, A008621. Complement of A047264. Equals A203016 divided by 3.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
